data.enText: to love sb/sth very much and want to protect them or it

data.chText: 儿童需要无微不至的爱护。
抱有（信念、希望）；怀有（好感）；怀念
data.enText: to keep an idea, a hope or a pleasant feeling in your mind for a long time
Cherish the memory of those days in Paris.

simple_means.memory_skill: cher〔= char〕可爱的 + ish 使… → 珍爱

value.def: If you cherish something such as a hope or a pleasant memory, you keep it in your mind for a long period of time.

example.ex: The president will cherish the memory of this visit to Ohio...
example.tran: 总统将铭记这次俄亥俄之行。

example.ex: It was a wonderful occasion which we will cherish for many years to come.
example.tran: 那是一个美好的时刻，我们将多年不忘。

value.tran: 怀有，抱有(希望);怀念(过去)

example.ex: ...the cherished dream of a world without wars.
example.tran: 梦想着一个没有战争的世界

value.def: If you cherish someone or something, you take good care of them because you love them.

example.ex: He genuinely loved and cherished her...
example.tran: 他由衷地爱恋并珍惜她。

example.ex: The previous owners had cherished the house.
example.tran: 房子先前的主人非常爱惜这房子。

example.ex: He described the picture as his most cherished possession.
example.tran: 他说那幅画是他最珍爱的财产。

value.def: If you cherish a right, a privilege, or a principle, you regard it as important and try hard to keep it.

example.ex: These people cherish their independence and sovereignty.
example.tran: 这些人民珍视他们的独立和主权。

value.tran: 珍视，维护，捍卫(权利、特权或原则)

example.ex: Freud called into question some deeply cherished beliefs.
example.tran: 弗洛伊德对人们先前深信不疑的一些观念提出了质疑。

partsOfSpeech.dec: car 可爱的 + ess 表女性 → 女性最需要爱抚 → 爱抚
char 可爱的 + isma → 可爱的东西 → 魅力
char 可爱的 + it + able …的，charity的形容词 → 慈善的
char 可爱的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 慈善
char 可爱的 + m → 魅力
cher〔= char〕可爱的 + ish 使… → 珍爱
